ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Magical drums? and a question
ygData.msgSnippet: I paid 25 for the COM coin and gave the druid who gave me the Emerald Jungle coin 25P. The kaesora coin I had to shell out 50P, but it was the last one I
ygData.messageBody:
I paid 25 for the COM coin and gave the druid who gave me the Emerald Jungle
coin 25P.

The kaesora coin I had to shell out 50P, but it was the last one I needed,
and I wasn't about to let a measly 25p extra get in my way (little did I
know that my guild had gotten me one in Kaesora the night before after I
left). Still whats 50P? At lvl 35 I usually make at least 200P a night
(keep in mind when I play I play for like 5 hours).

This brings me to a question for all of you out there. When fighting
casters I normally go to full pixie strike mode. I can usually get about
half the spells interupted (including almost all heals as they are fairly
slow cast). When fighting mellee mobs I normally play Chant of Battle (drum
song), Binding (our enchanters LOVE me for this, as it seems to taunt all
the mezzed mobs to me when they break) and something else (hymm, damage
shield, rhythm, depends).

Do you think I would now be better served throwing the drum in my hand and
singing rhythm, chant of battle and either guardian rhythms or Curtaling
chant or hymm (with mandolin) against casters?

I may experiment this weekend, but I'd like some input first.

Elfson Allegro
35 Half Barbarian Bard Veeshan
